about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if:

about.name: It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if:

hasPart.assesses: It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if: | It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: After coming to a complete stop, you may turn left at a red light only if you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street. Only make the turn if there are no posted signs prohibiting such a turn.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.

comment.text: You are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.

comment.text: You are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.

suggestedAnswer.text: You yield to all other traffic at the intersection.

comment.text: You yield to all other traffic at the intersection.

acceptedAnswer.text: You are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.

comment.text: You are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.

answerExplanation.text: After coming to a complete stop, you may turn left at a red light only if you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street. Only make the turn if there are no posted signs prohibiting such a turn.

comment.text: It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if: | After coming to a complete stop, you may turn left at a red light only if you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street. Only make the turn if there are no posted signs prohibiting such a turn.

hasPart.name: You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first?

about.name: You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first?

hasPart.assesses: You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first? | You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If your vehicle leaves the roadway, hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes. Wait until your speed has reduced, check the traffic, and look for a place to safely return to the roadway by merging back into traffic. Overcompensating by jerking the wheel to return to the roadway can cause you to lose control of your vehicle or may cause your car to go into other lanes of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn the front wheels slightly to the left to edge the car back onto the pavement.

comment.text: Turn the front wheels slightly to the left to edge the car back onto the pavement.

suggestedAnswer.text: Hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes.

comment.text: Hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Apply the brakes and turn the front wheels sharply to the left.

comment.text: Apply the brakes and turn the front wheels sharply to the left.

acceptedAnswer.text: Hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes.

comment.text: Hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes.

answerExplanation.text: If your vehicle leaves the roadway, hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes. Wait until your speed has reduced, check the traffic, and look for a place to safely return to the roadway by merging back into traffic. Overcompensating by jerking the wheel to return to the roadway can cause you to lose control of your vehicle or may cause your car to go into other lanes of traffic.

comment.text: You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first? | If your vehicle leaves the roadway, hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes. Wait until your speed has reduced, check the traffic, and look for a place to safely return to the roadway by merging back into traffic. Overcompensating by jerking the wheel to return to the roadway can cause you to lose control of your vehicle or may cause your car to go into other lanes of traffic.

hasPart.name: Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision?

about.name: Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision? | Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Every time you pass another vehicle, you increase your chances of being in a collision.

suggestedAnswer.text: Looking over your shoulder while making lane changes

comment.text: Looking over your shoulder while making lane changes

suggestedAnswer.text: Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles

comment.text: Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles

suggestedAnswer.text: Adjusting your rearview mirror before you start driving

comment.text: Adjusting your rearview mirror before you start driving

acceptedAnswer.text: Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles

comment.text: Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles

answerExplanation.text: Every time you pass another vehicle, you increase your chances of being in a collision.

hasPart.name: To avoid hydroplaning while driving in rainy conditions, you should:

about.name: To avoid hydroplaning while driving in rainy conditions, you should:

hasPart.assesses: To avoid hydroplaning while driving in rainy conditions, you should: | To avoid hydroplaning while driving in rainy conditions, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving too quickly in wet conditions, your tires may lose all contact with the road surface. Loss of traction will cause the vehicle to ride on top of the water, which is called "hydroplaning." The best way to prevent this from happening is to drive more slowly in rainy or wet conditions than you would when driving during ideal weather conditions.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive at a speed appropriate for ideal conditions.

comment.text: Drive at a speed appropriate for ideal conditions.

suggestedAnswer.text: Apply your brakes as soon as your car starts to skid.

comment.text: Apply your brakes as soon as your car starts to skid.
Slow down.
Slow down.

answerExplanation.text: When driving too quickly in wet conditions, your tires may lose all contact with the road surface. Loss of traction will cause the vehicle to ride on top of the water, which is called "hydroplaning." The best way to prevent this from happening is to drive more slowly in rainy or wet conditions than you would when driving during ideal weather conditions.

comment.text: To avoid hydroplaning while driving in rainy conditions, you should: | When driving too quickly in wet conditions, your tires may lose all contact with the road surface. Loss of traction will cause the vehicle to ride on top of the water, which is called "hydroplaning." The best way to prevent this from happening is to drive more slowly in rainy or wet conditions than you would when driving during ideal weather conditions.

hasPart.name: If you come across livestock or other animals on the roadway, you should:

about.name: If you come across livestock or other animals on the roadway, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you come across livestock or other animals on the roadway, you should: | If you come across livestock or other animals on the roadway, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If you are driving and come across an animal of any kind in the road, try to slow down and stop if it's safe to do so. Swerving to avoid an animal can be dangerous because your vehicle may lose control and cause an accident.

comment.text: Swerve out of the way.
Slow down and stop.
Ignore them.
Slow down and stop.

answerExplanation.text: If you are driving and come across an animal of any kind in the road, try to slow down and stop if it's safe to do so. Swerving to avoid an animal can be dangerous because your vehicle may lose control and cause an accident.

comment.text: If you come across livestock or other animals on the roadway, you should: | If you are driving and come across an animal of any kind in the road, try to slow down and stop if it's safe to do so. Swerving to avoid an animal can be dangerous because your vehicle may lose control and cause an accident.
